title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2 EDUCATION SUPPLY AND QUALITY

description.narrative: By 2024, the early childhood and basic education subsectors have the capacity to reduce the number of out-of-school children, and to improve enrolment, retention and completion through delivering quality, equitable, learner- and gender-sensitive pedagogy for all children including adolescents, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024 more school-aged girls and boys, especially the disadvantaged, have equitable access to quality inclusive early childhood and basic education.

mailing-address.narrative: Sekou Toure Avenue Mamba Point Monrovia

Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

related-activity.ref: 2550/A0/09/882 OUTCOME 2:. EARLY LEARNING AND BASIC EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, the early childhood and basic education subsectors have the capacity to reduce the number of out-of-school children, andto improve enrolment, retention and completion through delivering quality, equitable, learner- and gender-sensitive pedagogy forall children including adolescents

description.narrative: The national EMIS reported total primary and junior high school enrolment of 776,153 (470,716 girls): 599,561 (294,193 girls) primary and 176,523 (84,168 girls) junior high students. The Education programme reached 515,178 of these students with remote and continuous learning opportunities in 2021. Hygiene kits were provided to 2,662 schools and 6,428 teachers were trained in psychosocial support to facilitate distance learning. The COVID-19 resurgence imposed limitations on programming while also creating opportunities to deepen initiatives in distance learning and use of community-based approaches in providing education. Community-based ECD centres planned for enhanced age-appropriate enrolment. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:25/01/2022
